Topic.Title: Cash flow is 4B.. Market cap should be 4x7 = 28B

Message.Msg: osulinn - you're too generous. AMZN TTM Fee Cash Flow is just $1.1B. You have to total all of their FCF since start of 2009 to exceed $4B ($4.6B). It has taken them over 4 years to genererate $4.6B. That is an average of $1.1B per year. So they are trading at more than 250x FCF. What a bargain at 0.4% FCF yield?! You would get a better return in a 3-YR t-bill (0.52%) with no risk.

Topic.Title: FedEx ups shipping rates by 4.7% starting July 1

Message.Msg: That argument has not worked for AMZN .. shipping costs have continued to outpace revenue every Q and will continue to going forward - irrespective of the fulfillment rollout. It is not only due to gas cost/fedex/UPS increases (and FC distance), but also AMZN revenue per unit / shipment is also decreasing, making shipping costs a higher and higher % of revenue. This is why AMZN has had to spend billions on new FC centers, but they are chasing their tail. They have been trying to find new revenue drivers which adds SKu's, which also makes each FC less efficient .. all adds up to less efficiency with increased size (proven over past 4 years in financials), not the economies of sclae predicted by analysts. Groceries will only make that equations worse - except this time, they are beginning with lower margins.

Topic.Title: FedEx ups shipping rates by 4.7% starting July 1

Message.Msg: AMZN has its own deal with carriers.

Topic.Title: Talking risk vs. reward

Message.Msg: The real players is the investment banks, they bought enough to send it near the all time high. Getting the momo chasers (index funds, traders, HFT) to chase up the so called $300 PT. It only cost them maybe 2-300k shares to send it into the "break out" zone than they can distribute it to the chasers, mini dip buyers and got all of their initial "front running" costs back and then some. Today, they got a lot of help from the existing momentum and Ebay. That's money well spent I'll say!!!

Message.Title: Derivativez such az swaps and optionz will not be honored when this market crashez
Message.Msg: "You still believe when this crashes they will default on paying off put buyers? They didn't even do that in 1987. If they did, game over for optionz." In '87, it waz junk bond leverage In 2000 it waz margin leverage using ipo's and insane stok splits In 2008 it waz housing leverage using mbs and cdo (gvt made levered bets whole - mistake) In 2015 it will be found to be weekly optionz, swaps, and leveraged etfs ( they will go to 0 and not be honored despite being bet correctly on direction). There iz simy too much leverage floating around out there to have all of these bets honored.

Topic.Title: What is driving this?

Message.Msg: More buyers than sellers is what is driving it up. Also when you have no earnings to speak of, if you can keep pushing up revenues by any means then it will sustain the stock price (the latest is web based grocery service). Jeff Bezos and Marc Benioff (of CRM fame) will be remembered as the legendary crooks of our time in cahoots with equally crooked wall street brokers and analysts who will shamelessly say "this time its different". The music will stop one day and heaven help those who cannot locate an empty chair.

Topic.Title: $299 Prime Flesh

Message.Msg: The S Cal grocery business is ultra competitive. There are many dominant low-priced/high volume B&M stores like El Super, Superior, Super King, Wal Mart Neighborhood, and Northgate in each square mile. "Prime Fresh" will only manage to pick up scrap meat. Mark this post because I predict that this move will only generate a tiny bump in sales while resulting in massive red ink on EPS.

Topic.Title: why didn't amazon go with a pick up groceries at your local grocer strategy?

Message.Msg: Logistic of this will be a nightmare and a cash burner for years. Produce are perishable goods have to be distributed quickly or it rots. Unless you have a well established network, the barrier to entry will be too great to conquer (Leave it to Bezos they say, yeah right). On the flip side, they will have to issue more debt or dilution to cover for the cost and I suppose that would be bullish [sarc].

Topic.Title: why didn't amazon go with a pick up groceries at your local grocer strategy?

Message.Msg: Rest assured that buyerz of amzn stock might let bezos yank their chain with a good tall tale, but shopperz of groceriez wont let bezos pull their meat, pluck their cherriez, or wax their cucumber - shopping for groceriez iz a very intimate process best left to onez own resourcez.
